title: Drawing, Water Carriers on the Magdalena (Bay), Barranquilla, Republic of Nueva Grenada, now Colombia, May 2, 1853
title_raw: Water Carriers on the Magdalena (Bay), Barranquilla, Republic of Nueva Grenada, now Colombia
medium: Graphite, brush and oxidized white gouache on cream-colored wove paper, darkened to brown and greenish gray
markings:
Recto: Stamped in ink, at center right: Lugt 457c
Verso: Stapmed in ink, at center: Lugt 457d
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite with figures, at top right: 2 Intensely green, large leaves / 3 cocoanuts; and at bottom right: water carriers on the Magdalena (Bay) / - Barranquilla - N. G.- May 2 - 1853
description: Horizontal view shows men, women and children upon or beside donkeys, most of whom carry barrels, while in the river a boat with four men is visible being rowed in left middle distance and an empty boat lies in the river in the right foreground. A wooded bank, visible in the distance, contains a fenced cocoanut grove, a house, and two figures at right.  Scattered clouds in the sky.  A woman's head with a water barrel is visible at upper left.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Water Carriers on the Magdalena (Bay), Barranquilla, Republic of Nueva Grenada, now Colombia, May 2, 1853. Graphite, brush and oxidized white gouache on cream-colored wove paper, darkened to brown and greenish gray. 
Gift of Louis P. Church. 1917-4-62
